13  package net.sf.oval.test.validator;
14  
15  import java.util.List;
16  
17  import junit.framework.TestCase;
18  import net.sf.oval.ConstraintViolation;
19  import net.sf.oval.Validator;
20  import net.sf.oval.constraint.Length;
21  import net.sf.oval.constraint.MatchPattern;
22  import net.sf.oval.constraint.NotEmpty;
23  import net.sf.oval.constraint.NotNull;
24  
25  /**
26   * @author Sebastian Thomschke
27   */
28  public class AssertFieldConstraintsValidationTest extends TestCase
29  {
30  	protected static class Person
31  	{
32  		@NotNull
33  		public String firstName;
34  
35  		@NotNull
36  		public String lastName;
37  
38  		@NotNull
39  		@Length(max = 6, message = "LENGTH")
40  		@NotEmpty(message = "NOT_EMPTY")
41  		@MatchPattern(pattern = PATTERN_ZIP_CODE, message = "MATCH_PATTERN")
42  		public String zipCode;
43  	}
44  
45  	private static final String PATTERN_ZIP_CODE = "^[0-9]*$";
46  
47  	public void testFieldValidation()
48  	{
49  		final Validator validator = new Validator();
50  
51  		// test @NotNull
52  		final Person p = new Person();
53  		List<ConstraintViolation> violations = validator.validate(p);
54  		assertTrue(violations.size() == 3);
55  
56  		// test @Length(max=)
57  		p.firstName = "Mike";
58  		p.lastName = "Mahoney";
59  		p.zipCode = "1234567";
60  		violations = validator.validate(p);
61  		assertTrue(violations.size() == 1);
62  		assertTrue(violations.get(0).getMessage().equals("LENGTH"));
63  
64  		// test @NotEmpty
65  		p.zipCode = "";
66  		violations = validator.validate(p);
67  		assertTrue(violations.size() == 1);
68  		assertTrue(violations.get(0).getMessage().equals("NOT_EMPTY"));
69  
70  		// test @RegEx
71  		p.zipCode = "dffd34";
72  		violations = validator.validate(p);
73  		assertTrue(violations.size() == 1);
74  		assertTrue(violations.get(0).getMessage().equals("MATCH_PATTERN"));
75  	}
76  }
This page was automatically generated by Maven
